name: Scorpion Kick
how_to_perform:
1. Start by lying on your back with your arms extended overhead and your legs straight.
2. Engage your core muscles to maintain a stable lower back. 
3. Lift your right leg up towards the ceiling, keeping it straight, while simultaneously lowering your left arm down towards the ground.
4. As you reach the top point of the movement, target the desired area with a kick, aiming for just above the left shoulder blade without actually touching it.
5. Hold this position briefly before slowly lowering your leg back down to the starting position.
6. Repeat on the other side by lifting your left leg and lowering your right arm.
short_summary: The scorpion is an exercise that targets the middle and upper back muscles in a more isolated manner, improving posture and reducing muscle imbalances
